intro: Calyptronoma kalbreyeri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of showy, tubular flowers that range in color from violet to white. The plant is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Calyptronoma kalbreyeri is known for its ability to bloom year-round under proper care.
